item.title: Moon add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
item.description: "The real things haven't changed. It is still best to be honest and truthful; to make the most of what we have; to be happy with simple pleasures; and have courage when things go wrong." -- Laura Ingalls Wilder

item.title: Moon add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
item.description: "I am beginning to learn that it is the sweet, simple things of life which are the real ones after all." -- Laura Ingalls Wilder

item.title: Moon add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
item.description: "There's no great loss without some small gain." -- Laura Ingalls Wilder

item.title: Moon add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Above all, don't lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others. And having no respect he ceases to love." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Moon add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "What is hell? I maintain that it is the suffering of being unable to love." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "If cats looked like frogs we'd realize what nasty, cruel little bastards they are. Style. That's what people remember." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It's not worth doing something unless someone, somewhere, would much rather you weren't doing it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'll be more enthusiastic about encouraging thinking outside the box when there's evidence of any thinking going on inside it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "In ancient times cats were worshipped as gods; they have not forgotten this." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Stories of imagination tend to upset those without one." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Time is a drug. Too much of it kills you." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "A good bookshop is just a genteel Black Hole that knows how to read." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Wisdom comes from experience. Experience is often a result of lack of wisdom." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "In the beginning there was nothing, which exploded." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "And what would humans be without love?" RARE, said Death." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Chaos is found in greatest abundance wherever order is being sought. It always defeats order, because it is better organized." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Insanity is catching." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It's still magic even if you know how it's done." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "We who think we are about to die will laugh at anything." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "She'd become a governess. It was one of the few jobs a known lady could do. And she'd taken to it well. She'd sworn that if she did indeed ever find herself dancing on rooftops with chimney sweeps she'd beat herself to death with her own umbrella." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The presence of those seeking the truth is infinitely to be preferred to the presence of those who think they've found it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Did I do anything last night that suggested I was sane?" -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "There isn't a way things should be. There's just what happens, and what we do." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Few religions are definite about the size of Heaven, but on the planet Earth the Book of Revelation (ch. XXI, v.16) gives it as a cube 12,000 furlongs on a side. This is somewhat less than 500,000,000,000,000,000,000 cubic feet. Even allowing that the Heavenly Host and other essential services take up at least two thirds of this space, this leaves about one million cubic feet of space for each human occupant- assuming that every creature that could be called ‘human’ is allowed in, and the the human race eventually totals a thousand times the numbers of humans alive up until now. This is such a generous amount of space that it suggests that room has also been provided for some alien races or - a happy thought - that pets are allowed." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "There is a rumour going around that I have found God. I think this is unlikely because I have enough difficulty finding my keys, and there is empirical evidence that they exist." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I DON'T HOLD WITH CRUELTY TO CATS." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Moon add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Sometimes it's better to light a flamethrower than curse the darkness." -- Terry Pratchett
